title: John Chapter 20 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 20 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 20 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 20.

questions.question: Who came to the sepulchre early while it was still dark?
options: Mary Magdalene
Simon Peter
John the Baptist
Thomas
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene
questions.explanation: John 20:1 states that Mary Magdalene came early while it was yet dark to the sepulchre.

questions.question: What did Mary Magdalene notice was taken away from the sepulchre?
options: The stone
The Lord
The linen clothes
The napkin
questions.correctAnswer: The stone
questions.explanation: John 20:1 mentions Mary Magdalene saw the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

questions.question: Who did Mary Magdalene run to after seeing the stone taken away?
options: Simon Peter and the other disciple
Thomas and Judas
James and John
The Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter and the other disciple
questions.explanation: John 20:2 describes Mary Magdalene running to Simon Peter and the other disciple after seeing the stone moved.

questions.question: Who outran the other to reach the sepulchre first?
options: The other disciple
Simon Peter
Mary Magdalene
Thomas
questions.correctAnswer: The other disciple
questions.explanation: John 20:4 states the other disciple outran Peter and came first to the sepulchre.

questions.question: What did the other disciple see lying in the sepulchre when he stooped down?
options: The linen clothes
The stone
The napkin
The empty tomb
questions.correctAnswer: The linen clothes
questions.explanation: John 20:5 mentions he saw the linen clothes lying in the sepulchre.

questions.question: Where was the napkin that had been about Jesus' head found?
options: Wrapped together in a place by itself
Lying with the linen clothes
On the ground outside
In the hands of Peter
questions.correctAnswer: Wrapped together in a place by itself
questions.explanation: John 20:7 specifies the napkin was not lying with the linen clothes but wrapped together by itself.

questions.question: Why did the other disciple believe after entering the sepulchre?
options: Because he saw the linen clothes and believed
Because Mary told him Jesus was alive
Because the stone was rolled away
Because he saw angels
questions.correctAnswer: Because he saw the linen clothes and believed
questions.explanation: John 20:8 says the other disciple saw and believed after viewing the linen clothes.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples immediately understood from scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 20:9 shows they did not yet understand the scripture that Jesus must rise again.

questions.question: What did Mary Magdalene see inside the sepulchre while weeping?
options: Two angels in white
Jesus standing
The stone rolled away
Peter and John
questions.correctAnswer: Two angels in white
questions.explanation: John 20:12 describes Mary seeing two angels sitting where Jesus' body had lain.

questions.question: Who did Mary Magdalene initially think Jesus was when she saw him standing?
options: The gardener
A stranger
An angel
Peter
questions.correctAnswer: The gardener
questions.explanation: John 20:15 shows Mary thought Jesus was the gardener when she first saw him.

questions.question: What name did Jesus call Mary Magdalene that made her recognize Him?
options: Mary
Rabboni
Master
Friend
questions.correctAnswer: Mary
questions.explanation: John 20:16 states Jesus called her 'Mary,' and she recognized Him.

questions.question: What message did Jesus instruct Mary Magdalene to deliver to his brethren?
options: I ascend unto my Father and your Father, and to my God and your God
I will come back soon
Peace be unto you
You must forgive others
questions.correctAnswer: I ascend unto my Father and your Father, and to my God and your God
questions.explanation: John 20:17 records Jesus telling Mary to tell the disciples about His ascension.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus appeared to the disciples with the doors open.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 20:19 states the doors were shut when Jesus appeared to the disciples.

questions.question: What did Jesus show the disciples to prove He was alive?
options: His hands and his side
The empty tomb
The stone rolled away
The linen clothes
questions.correctAnswer: His hands and his side
questions.explanation: John 20:20 says Jesus showed his hands and side to the disciples.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus breathed on the disciples and said, 'Receive ye the ______.'
options: Holy Ghost
Holy Spirit
Spirit of God
Spirit of Truth
questions.correctAnswer: Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: John 20:22 records Jesus breathing on them and saying, 'Receive ye the Holy Ghost.'

medium.title: John Chapter 20 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 20 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt after hearing about Jesus' resurrection. Based on John 20, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their faith?
options: Seeing Jesus' wounds helped Thomas believe
Faith should only be based on physical proof
Doubt is unforgivable in believers
Only the disciples saw Jesus after the resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: Seeing Jesus' wounds helped Thomas believe
questions.explanation: John 20:24-28 shows Thomas doubted until he saw Jesus' wounds. Jesus invited him to believe by touching His hands and side, teaching that faith can be strengthened through honest questions and encounter with Christ.

questions.question: How does Mary Magdalene's example in John 20 teach us about personal devotion and prayer in times of distress?
options: She remained at the tomb weeping and seeking Jesus
She immediately left the tomb after seeing it empty
She ignored the angels and ran away
She doubted Jesus had risen
questions.correctAnswer: She remained at the tomb weeping and seeking Jesus
questions.explanation: John 20:11-13 shows Mary Magdalene stayed at the tomb, expressing sorrow and searching for Jesus. This teaches us to be persistent in prayer and devotion even in difficult times.

questions.question: A believer is hesitant to share their faith with others. What does Jesus' instruction in John 20:21 teach about evangelism and obedience?
options: Jesus sends His followers just as the Father sent Him
Evangelism is optional for believers
Only priests are responsible for sharing the Gospel
Jesus told the disciples to hide for safety
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus sends His followers just as the Father sent Him
questions.explanation: John 20:21 emphasizes that Jesus commissions His disciples to go out and share the Gospel with the same purpose and authority as the Father sent Him, highlighting the call to active obedience in evangelism.

questions.question: How does Jesus breathing on the disciples and giving them the Holy Spirit in John 20:22 teach about spiritual empowerment for service?
options: The Holy Spirit empowers believers to forgive sins and serve
The Holy Spirit is only for Old Testament prophets
Believers must rely solely on their own strength
The Spirit was given only to Peter
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit empowers believers to forgive sins and serve
questions.explanation: In John 20:22-23, Jesus breathes the Holy Spirit onto His disciples, giving them authority to forgive sins, illustrating that spiritual empowerment is essential for ministry and reconciliation.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can we learn from the way the disciples reacted when Jesus appeared to them in John 20:19-20?
options: They were glad and peaceful despite their fear
They immediately doubted Jesus' resurrection
They questioned Jesus’ authority
They left the room in confusion
questions.correctAnswer: They were glad and peaceful despite their fear
questions.explanation: John 20:19-20 shows the disciples initially fearful but became joyful and peaceful after seeing Jesus, teaching that faith brings contentment and overcomes fear.

questions.question: A Christian is experiencing grief and loss. How does Mary Magdalene’s encounter at the tomb in John 20:14-16 teach us about hope and recognition of Christ in trials?
options: Jesus calls by name, bringing hope even when unrecognized
Grief means God has abandoned us
We should avoid facing painful situations
Hope comes only after the resurrection is fully understood
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus calls by name, bringing hope even when unrecognized
questions.explanation: John 20:14-16 shows that though Mary did not initially recognize Jesus, His personal calling gave her hope, illustrating God’s intimate care in times of sorrow.

questions.question: How can the disciples’ initial unbelief and later faith in John 20 encourage perseverance through trials in our spiritual journey?
options: They doubted until they saw Jesus but ultimately believed
They never doubted but always believed
Unbelief means a lack of salvation
Faith is only for perfect people
questions.correctAnswer: They doubted until they saw Jesus but ultimately believed
questions.explanation: John 20:8-9 and 24-29 show the disciples’ journey from doubt to faith, teaching us that perseverance through spiritual struggles leads to deeper belief.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ words to Mary Magdalene in John 20:17 about ascending to the Father teach humility and obedience in Christian living?
options: Jesus instructs Mary to tell the disciples about His ascension
Jesus tells Mary to worship Him immediately
Jesus forbids anyone from speaking about Him
Jesus commands Mary to stay at the tomb
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus instructs Mary to tell the disciples about His ascension
questions.explanation: In John 20:17, Jesus humbly asks Mary to obey His instruction to inform the disciples, highlighting the importance of obedience and humility in following God’s plan.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 20:25, Thomas believed immediately without needing any proof of Jesus' resurrection.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 20:25 shows Thomas doubted until he saw Jesus' wounds, indicating that he needed proof before believing.

questions.question: True or False: John 20 teaches that faith is blessed even when it comes without physical sight of Jesus.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 20:29 records Jesus stating that those who believe without seeing are blessed, highlighting the value of faith beyond physical evidence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to John 20:31, the signs recorded in this book are written so that you might _______ that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God.
options: believe
doubt
question
ignore
questions.correctAnswer: believe
questions.explanation: John 20:31 clearly states that the signs are written so that readers might believe Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, emphasizing faith as the goal.

questions.question: How does the disciples’ reaction to the empty tomb in John 20:3-8 teach us about honesty and integrity in sharing difficult news?
options: They investigated the facts before believing
They ignored the empty tomb
They lied about Jesus' resurrection
They immediately spread rumors
questions.correctAnswer: They investigated the facts before believing
questions.explanation: John 20:3-8 shows Peter and the other disciple ran to the tomb and examined it carefully, demonstrating the importance of verifying facts honestly before sharing news.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to forgive someone who has wronged them. How does Jesus' authority to forgive sins given in John 20:23 guide us in practicing forgiveness?
options: Jesus grants believers authority to forgive and retain sins
Only priests can forgive sins
Forgiveness is unnecessary
Forgiveness should be withheld
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus grants believers authority to forgive and retain sins
questions.explanation: John 20:23 shows Jesus giving His disciples authority to forgive sins, teaching the church's role in reconciliation and encouraging believers to practice forgiveness.

questions.question: How does Jesus' greeting 'Peace be unto you' in John 20:19 and 21 teach contentment and trust amid fear and uncertainty?
options: Jesus brings peace to calm fears and encourage trust
Peace comes from avoiding problems
Fear should dominate a believer’s heart
Peace is only for the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus brings peace to calm fears and encourage trust
questions.explanation: John 20:19 and 21 shows Jesus greeting His disciples with peace, reassuring them despite their fear, teaching that Christ’s peace brings contentment in trials.

questions.question: How does Mary Magdalene’s witness to the disciples in John 20:18 encourage us in evangelism and church fellowship?
options: She promptly shared the news of Jesus’ resurrection
She kept the resurrection to herself
She told only one disciple
She doubted herself and did not testify
questions.correctAnswer: She promptly shared the news of Jesus’ resurrection
questions.explanation: John 20:18 records Mary Magdalene telling the disciples she had seen the Lord, modeling faithful witness and encouraging active participation in church fellowship.

hard.title: John Chapter 20 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 20.

questions.question: What significant event is foreshadowed by the linen cloths and separate napkin found in the empty tomb?
options: The bodily resurrection of Jesus
The burial customs of ancient Israel
The coming of the Holy Spirit
The ascension of Jesus into heaven
questions.correctAnswer: The bodily resurrection of Jesus
questions.explanation: John 20:6-7 describes the linen clothes lying and the napkin wrapped separately, symbolizing Jesus’ resurrection and the orderly nature of His departure from death, contrasting with typical grave robbery.

questions.question: In John 20, Mary Magdalene mistakes Jesus for whom, and what cultural understanding does this reflect?
options: The gardener, reflecting the common role of gardeners as caretakers of tombs
A Roman soldier, reflecting the occupation of guards at the tomb
A tax collector, reflecting social mistrust
A Pharisee, reflecting religious authority
questions.correctAnswer: The gardener, reflecting the common role of gardeners as caretakers of tombs
questions.explanation: John 20:15 shows Mary addressing Jesus as 'Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him,' supposing Him to be the gardener, which reflects the cultural role gardeners had in tending burial sites.

questions.question: The phrase 'Peace be unto you' spoken by Jesus in John 20:19 and 21 is a deliberate echo of which Old Testament blessing?
options: The Priestly Blessing from Numbers 6:24-26
The blessing of Abraham in Genesis 12
The Davidic covenant in 2 Samuel 7
The Aaronic benediction in Leviticus 9
questions.correctAnswer: The Priestly Blessing from Numbers 6:24-26
questions.explanation: Jesus’ greeting 'Peace be unto you' in John 20:19 and 21 parallels the Hebrew priestly blessing in Numbers 6:24-26, emphasizing divine peace and presence with His disciples.

questions.question: How does the interaction between Jesus and Thomas in John 20:27-28 serve as a theological climax in the chapter?
options: Thomas’ declaration 'My Lord and my God' affirms Jesus’ divinity
Thomas doubts and rejects Jesus’ resurrection
Thomas asks Jesus to perform a miracle
Thomas leaves the group to preach elsewhere
questions.correctAnswer: Thomas’ declaration 'My Lord and my God' affirms Jesus’ divinity
questions.explanation: John 20:28 records Thomas’ confession of Jesus as 'My Lord and my God,' marking a profound recognition of Jesus’ divine identity, central to Johannine Christology.

questions.question: What literary device is used in John 20:29 when Jesus says, 'Blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed'?
options: Beatitude, a pronouncement of blessing
Parable, a symbolic story
Chiasmus, a mirrored structure
Typology, an Old Testament foreshadowing
questions.correctAnswer: Beatitude, a pronouncement of blessing
questions.explanation: John 20:29 uses a beatitude, a form of blessing common in Jewish teaching (cf. Psalms and Beatitudes in Matthew), pronouncing blessing on those who believe without physical sight.

questions.question: In John 20:22, Jesus breathes on the disciples and says, 'Receive ye the Holy Ghost.' What Old Testament event does this action parallel?
options: God breathing life into Adam in Genesis 2:7
Elijah calling fire from heaven in 1 Kings 18
Moses striking the rock to bring water in Exodus 17
Noah sending out the dove in Genesis 8
questions.correctAnswer: God breathing life into Adam in Genesis 2:7
questions.explanation: Jesus breathing on the disciples in John 20:22 echoes God’s breath giving life to Adam in Genesis 2:7, symbolizing new spiritual life in the disciples through the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'first day of the week' in John 20:1 and its connection to early Christian worship?
options: It marks the day of Jesus’ resurrection and became the primary day for Christian worship
It was the traditional Jewish Sabbath rest day
It commemorates the giving of the Law at Sinai
It coincides with the Roman festival of Saturnalia
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the day of Jesus’ resurrection and became the primary day for Christian worship
questions.explanation: John 20:1 references the first day of the week, Sunday, which early Christians recognized as the day Jesus rose from the dead, establishing it as the main day for worship and gathering.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 20, the disciples immediately understood from the Scriptures that Jesus must rise from the dead.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 20:9 explicitly states 'For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead,' indicating their lack of understanding at that moment.

questions.question: Which theme prevalent throughout the Gospel of John is emphasized by the testimony of Mary Magdalene in John 20:18?
options: Witness and testimony of Jesus as the risen Lord
Law and commandments
Parables about the kingdom
Prophecies about the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: Witness and testimony of Jesus as the risen Lord
questions.explanation: John 20:18 shows Mary Magdalene as the first witness to the resurrection, emphasizing the Johannine theme of testimony and belief in Jesus as the risen Christ.

questions.question: How does the description of the angels in John 20:12 function within the narrative structure of the resurrection account?
options: They serve as heavenly witnesses confirming the resurrection
They instruct the disciples to flee Judea
They announce a new law for the community
They perform a miracle to open the tomb
questions.correctAnswer: They serve as heavenly witnesses confirming the resurrection
questions.explanation: John 20:12 mentions two angels seated where Jesus’ body had lain, symbolizing divine confirmation and adding heavenly authority to the resurrection event.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus saying 'Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father' to Mary Magdalene in John 20:17 in relation to His resurrection body?
options: It suggests the resurrection body has a different mode of physicality and is not yet fully glorified
It means Mary was not allowed to see him
It indicates that Jesus was still dead
It forbids any future physical contact with Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: It suggests the resurrection body has a different mode of physicality and is not yet fully glorified
questions.explanation: John 20:17 implies Jesus’ resurrection body is real but not yet in its final glorified state, foreshadowing His ascension and the new nature of resurrected life.

questions.question: How does the narrative of the disciples running to the tomb in John 20:3-4 demonstrate the Johannine emphasis on the 'beloved disciple'?
options: The beloved disciple outruns Peter and arrives first, showing his special role
Peter outruns the beloved disciple, showing leadership
Both arrive at the same time, showing equality
Only Peter is mentioned as going to the tomb
questions.correctAnswer: The beloved disciple outruns Peter and arrives first, showing his special role
questions.explanation: John 20:4 highlights that the disciple Jesus loved outran Peter, emphasizing his intimate connection to Jesus and reinforcing Johannine authorship tradition.

questions.question: In the context of John 20, what is the theological importance of Jesus granting the disciples authority to remit and retain sins in John 20:23?
options: It establishes the foundation for ecclesiastical authority and forgiveness
It refers to a political power over the Romans
It limits forgiveness only to Peter
It abolishes the Old Testament Law
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes the foundation for ecclesiastical authority and forgiveness
questions.explanation: John 20:23 entrusts the disciples with authority to forgive sins, a foundational moment for church ministry and the administration of grace.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 20:24-25, Thomas immediately believed the disciples' report of Jesus' resurrection without requiring physical proof.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 20:25 records Thomas’ doubt and his demand for physical evidence of Jesus’ wounds before he would believe, highlighting the theme of faith and sight.

questions.question: What is the authorial intent stated in John 20:31 for writing this Gospel, especially in light of the resurrection account?
options: To lead readers to believe Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and have life through His name
To provide a detailed historical record of Jesus’ life
To prove the Jewish Messiahship to the Pharisees
To outline the laws of the new covenant
questions.correctAnswer: To lead readers to believe Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and have life through His name
questions.explanation: John 20:31 explicitly states that the signs and resurrection account are written so readers may believe in Jesus as the Messiah and receive eternal life.

theological.title: John Chapter 20 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 20 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to John 20, what was the significance of the linen clothes found in the empty tomb?
options: They showed that Jesus had risen bodily and left the gravecloths behind
They indicated that Jesus' body had been stolen
They were a sign of Jesus' burial customs only
They were evidence of a natural decomposition process
questions.correctAnswer: They showed that Jesus had risen bodily and left the gravecloths behind
questions.explanation: John 20:6-7 describes the linen clothes and the napkin folded separately, indicating a deliberate leaving behind consistent with bodily resurrection, not theft or decomposition. This aligns with Luke 24:12, 1 Corinthians 15:4, and Isaiah 53:10-11 which affirm bodily resurrection.

questions.question: Who was the first person to see the risen Jesus according to John 20?
options: Mary Magdalene
Simon Peter
The disciple Jesus loved
Thomas
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene
questions.explanation: John 20:14-16 recounts that Mary Magdalene saw Jesus first and recognized Him after He called her by name. This is consistent with Luke 24:10 and Mark 16:9, affirming Mary's role as the first witness of the resurrection.

questions.question: What did Jesus mean when He told Mary Magdalene 'Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father'?
options: He was indicating His resurrection body was real but His ascension was still pending
He did not want to be touched by anyone
He was still dead and not able to be touched
He was instructing her to keep the resurrection secret
questions.correctAnswer: He was indicating His resurrection body was real but His ascension was still pending
questions.explanation: John 20:17 shows Jesus affirming His resurrection body yet signaling that His ascension and exaltation to the Father had not yet occurred. This points to His continuing mission and glorification, consistent with Acts 1:9-11 and Philippians 2:9-11.

questions.question: What does Jesus breathing on the disciples and saying 'Receive ye the Holy Ghost' signify in John 20?
options: The impartation of the Holy Spirit to empower the church
A symbolic gesture without real effect
A command to keep silent about the resurrection
A ritual cleansing from sin
questions.correctAnswer: The impartation of the Holy Spirit to empower the church
questions.explanation: John 20:22 describes Jesus giving the Holy Spirit to the disciples, signifying the new birth and empowerment for mission, paralleling Joel 2:28-29, Acts 1:4-8, Romans 8:9, and Ezekiel 36:26-27.

questions.question: What authority does Jesus give to His disciples regarding sin in John 20?
options: To remit (forgive) or retain sins
To judge sinners harshly
To ignore sin among believers
To impose legalistic rules
questions.correctAnswer: To remit (forgive) or retain sins
questions.explanation: John 20:23 grants the disciples authority to forgive or retain sins, indicating a spiritual authority connected to the gospel mission and the ministry of reconciliation (2 Corinthians 5:18-20, Matthew 16:19, Matthew 18:18, Isaiah 43:25).

questions.question: Why did Thomas refuse to believe the resurrection until he saw Jesus' wounds?
options: He needed empirical proof to overcome doubt
He wanted to disprove the resurrection
He was absent due to fear
He did not love Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: He needed empirical proof to overcome doubt
questions.explanation: John 20:25 shows Thomas's demand for physical evidence to believe, highlighting a human struggle with doubt and the reality of the resurrection body. This addresses apologetic challenges and is echoed in 1 John 1:1-3 and Luke 24:39-40.

questions.question: What was Jesus' response to Thomas's doubt and request for proof?
options: He invited Thomas to touch His wounds and believe
He rebuked Thomas harshly
He avoided Thomas
He declared Thomas faithless without hope
questions.correctAnswer: He invited Thomas to touch His wounds and believe
questions.explanation: John 20:27 recounts Jesus' patient invitation to Thomas to examine His wounds, teaching faith based on evidence but also blessing those who believe without seeing (John 20:29). This emphasizes grace and the nature of faith (Hebrews 11:1, Romans 4:20-21).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Thomas declaring Jesus 'My Lord and my God'?
options: It affirms the deity of the risen Christ
It shows Thomas was confused
It means Jesus was only a great prophet
It is a metaphor for friendship
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms the deity of the risen Christ
questions.explanation: John 20:28 is a profound confession of Christ's divine lordship, supporting Christology that Jesus is fully God, consistent with John 1:1, Colossians 2:9, Philippians 2:6, and Hebrews 1:3.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the signs recorded in John 20 according to verse 31?
options: To lead readers to believe Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and have life through His name
To provide a historical record only
To show Jesus was a political leader
To confuse unbelievers
questions.correctAnswer: To lead readers to believe Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and have life through His name
questions.explanation: John 20:31 explicitly states the signs are written that readers might believe in Jesus' messianic identity and receive eternal life, aligning with John 3:16, Romans 10:9, Acts 4:12, and 1 John 5:11-13.

questions.question: How does John 20 present the resurrection as fulfillment of Scripture?
options: The disciples did not yet understand it fulfilled Scripture
It was an unexpected event with no scriptural basis
It contradicted the Law of Moses
It only fulfilled Roman prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples did not yet understand it fulfilled Scripture
questions.explanation: John 20:9 notes the disciples did not yet grasp the resurrection as fulfillment of Scripture, pointing to the need for revelation and understanding, consistent with Luke 24:25-27, 1 Corinthians 15:3-4, Psalm 16:10, and Isaiah 53.

questions.question: What does Jesus' greeting 'Peace be unto you' signify in the context of John 20?
options: The restoration of fellowship and the gift of divine peace after resurrection
A casual hello without deeper meaning
A political slogan
A farewell statement
questions.correctAnswer: The restoration of fellowship and the gift of divine peace after resurrection
questions.explanation: John 20:19 and 21 show Jesus greeting the disciples with peace, symbolizing reconciliation, cessation of fear, and the presence of God's shalom, echoing Isaiah 9:6, Numbers 6:24-26, Philippians 4:7, and Romans 5:1.

questions.question: What theological truth is taught by Jesus appearing to His disciples behind locked doors?
options: The resurrected Jesus has a glorified body that transcends physical barriers
Jesus appeared only in a vision
The doors were actually open
The disciples were hallucinating
questions.correctAnswer: The resurrected Jesus has a glorified body that transcends physical barriers
questions.explanation: John 20:19 and 26 describe Jesus entering despite locked doors, affirming His resurrection body’s glorified nature, consistent with Luke 24:39-40 and 1 Corinthians 15:44-49, distinguishing resurrection from mere spiritual apparition.

questions.question: What does the presence of angels at the tomb in John 20 symbolize?
options: Divine witness and confirmation of the resurrection
Ghostly apparitions
A sign of judgment
An unrelated event
questions.correctAnswer: Divine witness and confirmation of the resurrection
questions.explanation: John 20:12 shows two angels at the tomb, symbolizing heavenly testimony to the resurrection event, aligning with Luke 24:4, Matthew 28:2-7, Hebrews 1:14, and Psalm 104:4 regarding angelic ministry.

questions.question: Why did Mary Magdalene initially not recognize Jesus after His resurrection?
options: She thought He was the gardener due to unfamiliarity with His resurrected appearance
She was blind
Jesus was disguised
She was not paying attention
questions.correctAnswer: She thought He was the gardener due to unfamiliarity with His resurrected appearance
questions.explanation: John 20:14-15 describes Mary mistaking Jesus for the gardener, indicating that the resurrection body had a transformed appearance, consistent with Luke 24:13-16 and 1 Corinthians 15:35-44 on resurrection transformation.

questions.question: What does Jesus' instruction to Mary Magdalene to 'go to my brethren' reveal about the early church?
options: It shows the commissioning of the disciples to spread the resurrection message
It indicates Mary was to build the church alone
It suggests secrecy about the resurrection
It prohibits women from church leadership
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the commissioning of the disciples to spread the resurrection message
questions.explanation: John 20:17 highlights Jesus sending Mary to the disciples, indicating the beginning of the apostolic mission and the centrality of witness and proclamation, consistent with Matthew 28:18-20, Acts 1:8, and Romans 10:14-15.
